articles.title: Fancy Flying Trick Could Bring Sensors to Earth’s “Ignorosphere”
articles.summary: Earth’s atmosphere is large, extending out to around 10,000 kilometers from the surface of the planet. It’s so large, in fact, that scientists break it into five separate sections. articles.title: It’s the End of the Line for AOL’s Dial-Up Service
articles.summary:
The last time I used a dial-up modem came sometime around 2001. Within just a few years, dial-up had exited my life, never to return. I haven’t even had a telephone line in my house for most of my adult life.



But I still feel a strong tinge of sadness to know that AOL is finally retiring the ol’ ...

articles.title: Trump Seeks to Cancel CHIPS Act R&D Organization’s Funds
articles.summary: The U.S. Commerce Department says it will not abide by an agreement to fund the U.S. CHIPS and Science Act’s R&D through the nonprofit set up to administer the program, called Natcast. Instead, it handed operational control to the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).Natcast was cre...

articles.title: Data Centers May House AI—But Operators Don’t Trust AI (Yet)
articles.summary: AI is starting to be trusted with high-stakes tasks, including running automated factories and guiding military drones through hostile airspace. But when it comes to managing the data centers that power this AI revolution, human operators are far more cautious.According to a new survey of over 600 d...

articles.title: The First Inkjet Printer Was a Medical Device
articles.summary: Millions of people worldwide have reason to be thankful that Swedish engineer Rune Elmqvist decided not to practice medicine. articles.summary: The future of wireless communication is today being sketched out in the skies and in space. articles.title: The Karaoke Machine’s Surprising Origin
articles.summary: Belting your favorite song over prerecorded music into a microphone in front of friends and strangers at karaoke is a popular way for people around the world to destress after work or celebrate a friend’s birthday. articles.title: This DIY Test Equipment Could Save Your Radio
articles.summary: Recently I noticed an irresistible offer on Craigslist: a Majestic 3C70 AM/shortwave radio for just US $50. articles.title: Tech Founders Must Prioritize the Problem Before Their Solution
articles.summary: When I left Los Alamos National Laboratory to start a company 11 years ago, I thought my team was ready.
